attributes.action: accept that the removal of tax relief on pension funds has proved economically fatal to UK pension savings, rescind the legislation and refund the £5 billion taken each year.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background: In 1997 Gordon Brown initiated a raid on pension funds to the tune of £5 billion per year. In the intervening nine years the UK's pension funds have been mugged of £45 billion. When he took over as Chancellor, GB inherited a situation where UK pension schemes were the envy of the world. They are now the laughing stock and many, many people have seen (or are seeing) their retirement plans go up in smoke. This petition asks the Prime Minister to rescind this damaging legislation and refund the shortfalls it has created.
